programme.title: Forged: Man At Arms
programme.sub-title: Man at Arms: Art of War
programme.desc: The team gets to work on the Arsti Thursting Spear and the Akinaka short sword, two weapons that helped to build the ancient Persian Empire.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: In the Wildfire Round, the chefs try not to crack under pressure. Then it is Fight or Flight in the Crossfire Round.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The Laguna brothers return to the mysterious island off Nova Scotia that is believed to be protected by a powerful curse, aiming to unearth its hidden treasures.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The swampers reflect on the most memorable moments of the series, recalling their greatest triumphs as well as the dangers they have faced.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie and his crew retrieve a stolen vehicle that crashed 500ft down into a ravine. Plus, after a tough winter, Adam considers leaving the Alberta operation.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff put a price on a 1940s mandolin, and try to determine if a signed print of Abraham Lincoln is genuine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a poster signed by Steve McQueen, and examine a diary from the American Civil War - but have a hard time making sense of the writing.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A family feud leads to Ashley's resignation. Meanwhile, a couple of women try to sell a dirty fur coat and a man offers to pawn his gold tooth.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les misses Ashley's presence in the shop, while a man employs menacing tactics to persuade the dealers to buy a couple of outdated computer monitors.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams trawl scrap metal heaps for bargain Japanese car parts. While one tackles a Subaru Impreza, the other strips a Mitsubishi Lancer Evo.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The team prepares a borehole for divers, after scanning sonar confirms a longheld belief that one of its chambers may contain a chest, as well as human remains.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: The Seedy Texas Motel Poltergeist and More
programme.desc: A travelling businessman encounters poltergeist activity in his Texas motel room and a UFO is spotted over one of the holiest sites on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos takes an in-depth look at extra-terrestrial mysteries. Here, he investigates whether the religious relic the Ark of the Covenant could hold connections to an extraterrestrial past.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a 1920s car with wooden wheels and a ball and chain from Arizona's oldest prison.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is placed in a difficult position when a client offers him a set of Saddam Hussein's fingerprints, originally taken by the FBI.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy is forced to defend his turf or score big with a home field advantage, but it is Mary that cleans up.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi lets Jarrod hold the purse strings. However, it is Mary who snags the most expensive locker of the day as the buyers hit California.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: In the Wildfire Round, the chefs try not to crack under pressure. Then it is Fight or Flight in the Crossfire Round.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The retailers scrutinise a signature apparently made by deposed Iraqi leader Saddam Hussein, and Les loses his cool with a customer over a broken necklace. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer brings in an Olympic torch used in the relay for the 2002 Winter Games, an event held in Salt Lake City, Utah.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams trawl scrap metal heaps for bargain Japanese car parts. While one tackles a Subaru Impreza, the other strips a Mitsubishi Lancer Evo.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team uses high-tech sidescan sonar and deep sea magnetometers to search for evidence after learning of an encounter with an underwater phenomenon.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The alleged existence of underground extraterrestrial lairs, concentrating on a cave in Ecuador said to hold alien knowledge, and a hidden city in Turkey.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The team prepares a borehole for divers, after scanning sonar confirms a longheld belief that one of its chambers may contain a chest, as well as human remains.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Patrick Pecker fills in for Don at the auction in Western Road, and Cindy tries to take advantage of the change.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Between a Brawk and a Hard Place
programme.desc: Ursual has broken a finger, and Roy teaches a parrot to do some trash-talking for him at an auction in Etobicoke.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: The signature round allows the chefs to serve up big flavours, big personality and some big mistakes.

programme.title: Ozzy & Jack's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Ozzy Osbourne and son Jack begin a history-filled world tour by heading to the UK to visit one landmark on both their bucket lists - Stonehenge.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Troy lays down a bet against Chase and Holden, Daniel's bragging wears Dwaine down, and Gunner causes trouble for Bruce.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi's plans go awry as the buyers hit Santa Ana and Dave shows up looking to cause trouble.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene brings his father Gunter to help hunt for collectibles and Ivy takes a gamble for something out of the ordinary.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A family feud leads to Ashley's resignation. Meanwhile, a couple of women try to sell a dirty fur coat and a man offers to pawn his gold tooth.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les misses Ashley's presence in the shop, while a man employs menacing tactics to persuade the dealers to buy a couple of outdated computer monitors.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Doc Martin star Martin Clunes hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz from June 2016, with comedian Jason Manford and Labour MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines that week.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Ross Noble, R'n'B singer Jamelia and academic Germaine Greer to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include folk-dancing, health-and-safety, text speak, smelly people, actors and fun-runs.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Matt Lucas, Holly Walsh and Susan Calman join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig opens her post in a post-themed edition. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: In 1850, a man wakes after a long illness and finds he is being cared for by strangers - but isn't allowed to leave. Read by Anna Friel.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle travel around the country to complete a variety of outlandish stunts, beginning with an attempt to bounce a man across a lake and into a target.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: More man-tastic DIY projects as brothers Kevin and Andrew Buckles engage in challenging and often quirky home improvement builds.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: More man-tastic DIY projects as brothers Kevin and Andrew Buckles engage in challenging and often quirky home improvement builds.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Danielle discovers Mike and Frank have been concealing an expensive secret, and an elderly artist shows the guys a shrine to his ex-lovers.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori and Brandon win one of two aviation storage units that have come up for sale, while biker Dan bags the other.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori find a hot-air balloon in their newly acquired trailer.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank organise a charity auction, and get a surprise when they visit a Kansas junkyard.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The teams take on one of the steepest courses in Red Bull Soapbox Race history in Lithuania. Will the soapboxes cope with the water jump and savage bone-rattler?.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Sixty teams take on a very quick course down Windhaven Parkway in Fort Worth. Who will triumph in the Lone Star State?.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Mercedes-Benz CLK Black Series through its paces, and Richard Hammond tests the limits of the Audi RS6 in a race against two French skiers. James May sets the show's bravery expert a daunting challenge involving an MG Maestro, while actors Rupert Penry-Jones and Peter Firth go head to head as Stars in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kate Williams, Tom Allen, Chizzy Akudolu and Charlie Higson continue testing their general knowledge skills in assorted trivia-based games before Friday's final.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Actor Mackenzie Crook, wildlife presenter Chris Packham, writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell and comedian Rhod Gilbert join David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with odd personal statements that may or may not be true.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Dara O Briain, Rich Hall and Arthur Smith for more interesting answers on subjects including biscuits, ballet and baboons in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May explore the old adage that having owned an Alfa Romeo is the sign of a real automobile addict, testing out three second-hand models, each bought for less than £1,000. The unwieldy Bentley Brooklands receives a power test, and Gavin & Stacey's James Corden and Rob Brydon go head to head as the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tries to prove the Nissan GT-R is faster than the celebrated Bullet Train in a race across Japan with Richard Hammond and James May. Toyota's idea of personal transport for the future is tested out and additional glamour is provided by the Alfa Romeo 8C, which takes to the Top Gear track. Newsreaders Fiona Bruce and Kate Silverton are the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Five new contestants, James Acaster, Jessica Knappett, Kerry Godliman, Phil Wang and Rhod Gilbert, complete a series of tasks.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kate Williams, Tom Allen, Chizzy Akudolu and Charlie Higson continue testing their general knowledge skills in assorted trivia-based games before Friday's final.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former deputy prime minister John Prescott, actress Rebecca Front and comedian Micky Flanagan join host Frank Skinner, making the case for their pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include goal celebrations, school ties, celebrity chefs, audience participation and other people's music.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Fred MacAulay and Rich Hall for more interesting answers on subjects including bees, barnacles and basketball in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Panellists Julia Zemiro, Matt Lucas and David Mitchell and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show. In this edition, the presenter meditates on matters medieval and macabre, and as usual, he poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Vic Reeves and Clive Anderson answer questions on the theme of espionage. Host Stephen Fry will be awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Jessica Knappett beautifully mimics a funny noise, Phil Wang makes ogres poignant despite his eye-catching costume and James Acaster finds various circles.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave suggests revamping the calendar and considers the upshot of buying Twitter followers.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Pointless co-host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Roisin Conaty and broadcaster James O'Brien joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history. At the time of Jack the Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner, George Chapman. Presenter Nicholas Day reveals how he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second programme this year from RAF Coningsby in Lincolnshire, and discovers the story of a length of tree that ended up inside a Lancaster bomber. Treasures brought in to be valued include a harp that survived the French Revolution, a curious wooden item with an unexpected purpose, a diamond brooch found hidden inside a barometer and a pair of Second World War propaganda posters printed on hessian sacking.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the startling similarities between humans and great apes, meeting an orang-utan able to row boats and wash clothes and a gorilla that can communicate using sign language. He also traces the history of human settlement and considers the future of population control and food production.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Walmer castle, Kent, and is challenged to identify a valuable 18th-century glass out of a collection of reproductions. Other items brought in to be valued include a rare pottery piglet, a revolving table with secret compartments, a British PoW's diary, a set of French fashion illustrations from the 1920s, a table clock and a collection of Victorian ceramic birds.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: The story of a chest full of jewels hidden in a Prussian castle that was later requisitioned by the US army as a base, and the plot by American officers to steal the loot.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A vast project in the icy wilderness of southern Alaska, and a landscape of confusing and surprising structures that represented a bold statement of Spain's plans for the future.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn explores St Pancras station in London and its sister hotel - built to show off the might of the Midlands, and learns about Castle Howard station in North Yorkshire.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright feels neglected by Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, and decides to feign an illness in an attempt to get her undivided attention, but she soon sees through the ruse.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Following a break-in, Arkwright decides to buy a guard dog to keep away potential burglars. Unfortunately, his new investment also scares off the customers.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Beth and Tyler announce they have become vegetarians and set off to Ludlow races to protest about the treatment of animals. Meanwhile, Jed's scarecrow in the barn is mistaken for a human body, and Marlene enrols on a mail-order reiki healing course as part of a plan to create a massage parlour and beauty salon at the farm.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Tyler is left cold by all the kerfuffle as the family awaits the arrival of his French exchange student. He even considers getting engaged to Beth in a bid to get out of paying a return visit to France. However, the guest's eventual arrival causes a stir all round. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie's competitive spirit is fired up when a broke Llewellyn challenges him to a pub quiz with a £5,000 jackpot - but sadly, Bryan, Jed and Marlene's general knowledge leaves a lot to be desired. Tyler tries to make amends after Beth accuses him of being anti-Welsh. Comedy, starring John Challis.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam and Harry investigate when a gruesome, partly mummified corpse is found after a lorry crashes into an old factory building. The forensic experts attempt to identify the remains by reconstructing the skull, while DCI Telford and DS Linden track down a woman who claims the body is that of a former boyfriend who disappeared seven years previously. It soon transpires that the deceased had unsavoury connections. Benedict Cumberbatch makes an early screen appearance, alongside stars Amanda Burton, William Gaminara and Tom Ward.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amber continues to tease Dan about his love life. Goaded by her constant jibes, he reluctantly admits to dating a married woman - much to the anger of Rochelle. Zain looks into the case of an Egyptian girl who has been reported missing twice in one day. Leela makes a grisly discovery, and Jo Masters goes undercover to investigate a series of drug overdoses at a private prison - only to encounter a figure from her past.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team search desperately for casualties as the fire on the private railway line blazes on. Meanwhile, Carole confronts Martin.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: B Company's new commander is unimpressed by his men's performances, and Dave's personal problems take their toll.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Joe competes in a boxing match, with the odds favouring him to win. Meanwhile, Collette sets her heart on a wedding Jo cannot afford.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amber continues to tease Dan about his love life. Goaded by her constant jibes, he reluctantly admits to dating a married woman - much to the anger of Rochelle. Zain looks into the case of an Egyptian girl who has been reported missing twice in one day. Leela makes a grisly discovery, and Jo Masters goes undercover to investigate a series of drug overdoses at a private prison - only to encounter a figure from her past.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra tells a patient he will be able to get his hands on HIV medication for her brother in Zambia, but as he searches for drugs in the basement with a torch, Ric sneaks up on him and turns the light on. Meanwhile, Elliot works a night shift to take his mind off Gina, and Matt tries to scare Donna by talking about the paranormal.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An emergency prompts Duffy to tell Andrew she's pregnant, and a lonely widower clashes with his neighbour over a large wooden Santa. Meanwhile, Charlie worries about Barney's seemingly uncontrollable temper, and Patrick receives bad news.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jo Masters goes undercover as a warder at Stonewall prison to investigate the source of drugs which have led to a spate of overdoses. Yvonne Hemmingway comes across an old flame involved in a shooting case and is forced to arrest him for concealing vital evidence, while Dan Casper's affair with commander's wife Rochelle Barratt is strained when they clash over a professional matter. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard reveals his true colours to Bianca. Natalie delivers some shocking news. Ian decides to claim his inheritance; where does this leave Mark? Phil gets another bargain.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Bianca finds out that Richard is not easily fooled.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: On an exchange trip to Holland, Nick is reunited with Marianne. Meanwhile, Blue Watch are called to a blaze at a fire station.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack and Beth disagree over the treatment of a young patient with a heart defect, while Sarah and Will's marriage deteriorates as their financial problems mount.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Harding announces his plans for the factory and whether he and Alice intend to stay in Skelthwaite permanently, while Sally and Billy make an important decision about their future. At the village summer fete, David and Anna go public about their relationship and are stunned by a surprise from Luke.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: A stranger asks for help with a leaking car radiator shortly before police turn up at the house, but it transpires he has a hidden agenda. Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene spots an opportunity to have her old possessions assessed by experts when the Antiques Roadshow arrives in Ludlow, and the farm's staff all share the same idea. However, it turns out that Boycie, with help from Tyler, is the only one to discover a truly valuable item. Fiona Bruce guest stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour invents a car safety device and as soon as he hears Nora Batty is to attend its demonstration, Compo volunteers to be the dummy that tests it. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio decide there is profit to be made from a heatwave, so Seymour designs a vendor's side car cooler to put Compo into business as an ice-cream man. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Charlie is appointed to defend an animal rights activist accused of murdering an eminent scientist - a case that will be heard before her father. The defence barrister's support for her client's cause leads her to make a series of unprofessional outbursts in court, while Jo's relationship with Marc Thompson creates tension.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team looks into the death of a terrorist 30 years previously after his daughter receives an anonymous note claiming he was murdered - an investigation that takes them right back to the Greenham Common anti-nuclear protests. Meanwhile, Sasha agrees to go for dinner with her ex-husband Ned, which he is hoping will lead to a reconciliation. Tamzin Outhwaite and Dennis Waterman star, with guest appearances from Barnaby Kay, Charlotte Cornwell and Patricia Potter.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A police cadet's body is found, and it soon transpires that his demise mirrors the death of another murder victim killed months previously. When Sam Ryan and her forensic team investigate, they discover the dead man's training college could prove vital in solving the crime. Acclaimed drama series, starring Amanda Burton, with a guest appearance by Tim Healy.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: The final three contenders have just two minutes to select from the larder containing a stunning array of fresh fruit and vegetables, pulses and grains, condiments and sauce ingredients to work in conjunction with crab meat. They then have 25 minutes to concoct a sumptuous meal. With a trio of Mediterranean-ispired crab dishes on the menu, judge Rosemary Shrager faces a mouth-watering feast before she must make the ultimate decision, upon which rests a £1,000 cash prize. Presented by Fern Britton.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Actor Kris Marshall chats about new film Trick or Treat, recent work in Jane Austen adaptation Sanditon, and life under lockdown in Somerset.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends from Birmingham answer top 10 list questions on subjects including the Olympic Games, West End Musicals and National Parks. Will they be able to score a Perfect 10 and win a big cash prize? Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: In the final episode of the ninth series, Martin rushes to Ruth's for a medical emergency, and preparations for Morwenna and Al's wedding do not go to plan. Elsewhere, Martin takes his final GMC assessment under the watchful eye of eminent surgeon Bernard Newton, who monitors Martin's skills in assisted surgery. Starring Martin Clunes, Tom Conti, Caroline Catz and Jessica Ransom.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the quiz, with six more contestants competing in Fastest Finger First to see who will sit in the hot seat and have the chance to take home the £1million jackpot. To make things easier, the players have four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help two more people who were found as babies after being abandoned to track down their birth families. Simon Jeffery was left in a box outside a railway tavern in Greenhithe, a story which hit the headlines but which he only learned about by chance at the age of 10. Fi Beazer was discovered in a public toilet in Warminster when she was only a few hours old. Both have spent their adult life trying to track down their parents, and submit DNA samples in the hope of finally getting the answers they seek.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Les Dawson Forever
programme.desc: Part two of two. Members of the dance troupe the Roly Polys reunite on stage to reminisce about working alongside Les and Les's wife Tracy Dawson reunites with karaoke superfan Penny Morgan, who was given the opportunity to perform the duet of a lifetime on Cilla Black's Surprise Surprise in 1993.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fifth episode, Adam attempts to master an ancient sport when he and Scott get a taste of Indian parklife. Elsewhere, Ryan and Dougie make a shock discovery about Dougie's grandmother, before the group join in with the festivities for the country's biggest party for Diwali.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating seemingly simple modern-day objects. This time, how rowing machines, Parma ham and London Underground signs are made.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace-mechanic Sam Lovegrove arrive in Cornwall, looking for something to buy, restore and sell on for a handsome profit. At a windswept hilltop farm they find cars, tractors and a very rare German scooter.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.sub-title: Hot Rods, Trucks and Miniture Bikes
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove are in the New Forest, looking for things to buy, restore and sell for profit, where they meet Stumpie, an Americana fanatic whose sheds are full of rare bicycles, classic sportsters and pimped-up saloon cars.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: An arctic hurricane decimates the crab grounds, forcing captains Elliot Neese and Scott Campbell Jr to make some tough decisions.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Surrey, a house is pulled to the ground and the team members seek original fixtures to sell for profit. In Cambridgeshire, metal traders break down massive machines.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to prove he can make money on a car without spending a fortune, while Edd China turns his attention to restoring a Mercedes-Benz SLK on a very tight budget.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini takes a Chrysler CG Imperial LeBaron Dual Cowl Phaeton to Kuwait's Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini enthuses about a 1931 Ford Model A Starlite coupe hot rod that won the Autoram as it goes under auction without a reserve.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: A look at the development of the Rolls-Royce Wraith, marketed by the company as a 'gentleman's GT'.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Fire Crew's season rests on a knife-edge as they battle their way back from a disastrous setback. The Opal Queen battles rock hard walls alone, desperate to find opal.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Winter arrives in Dutch Harbor and the fleet prepares to hunt opilio crab, but before any lines are thrown a deckhand quits and two brothers fight, with one going overboard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit Dan, a born-and-raised New Englander whose collection might turn out to be off-limits.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits some family-run businesses in Lincolnshire and Norfolk in the hope of finding rare and unusual antiques that have never been put on sale before.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Hampshire, an old leisure centre is torn to the ground. Then, in Lincolnshire a team scour military settings for old weaponry that can be turned into cash.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer travels to Yorkshire to examine a TVR S2 that is up for auction.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China experiences a series of problems while working on the TVR S2, which leaves Mike Brewer wondering if it will be ready for him in time to sell at a profit.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin tackles a deal that could make or break him. The Boulder Boys race to save their claim from a monsoon flood, while the Cooke Brothers finally make a valuable discovery.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard meets an Oxfordshire aristocrat who owns his own steam train, and picks up an American sign and a Victorian oil lamp.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: The arrival of a 747 Jumbo Jet has the team members itching to dismantle this giant of the sky. However, they immediately struggle fitting it into the parking bay.

programme.title: Steel Buddies
programme.desc: Michael embarks on some shopping trips to the US, tries to get his airplane business of the ground and races to deliver three school buses to Savannah port on time.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of insulin from a loaf of bread, the manufacture of rigging for ships and how green salad is cultivated on scorching desert planes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of the world's most powerful locomotive, how cows' milk is turned into clotted cream, and the crafting of a boomerang from a piece of wood.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer finds a Land Rover Discovery for £1,500 and hands it over to mechanic Edd China for restoration work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mechanic Edd China finishes working on the Land Rover Discovery and, after a successful road test, Mike Brewer has a buyer lined up.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into how a murder can be solved by simple scraps of evidence such as dirt on shoes or a small piece of plastic.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When 69-year-old Ina Clare Richardson was found brutally murdered in a park, police turned to security cameras to piece together the puzzle of her death.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The stabbing of Arkansas cheerleader Julie Heath in October 1993. Eric Nance raped and murdered the 18-year-old, and 12 years later was put to death for the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a man who abducted a girl from a bus stop before assaulting her fled from the police, leaving a trail of theft and violence.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Scott Wernick is unable to save the life of an emaciated horse, but later witnesses the birth of a calf.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to Abu Dhabi after a special invitation to visit an extraordinary veterinary hospital, where sick and injured falcons are treated like royalty.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride who loves peacocks and another who loves purple battle with their bridesmaids, while another prays pink dresses will save her wedding day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Cancer survivor Joya's dream dress is beyond her budget, but her friends offer support. Ria knows exactly which gown she wants, but her picky entourage are not keen.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Kari wants a conservative dress, but her mother is looking for something more revealing, while Nita's couture tastes do not fit with her mother's off-the-rack budget.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits head to Villeneuve-lès-Avignon in southern France, where each get 800 euros to spend on collectibles to sell in Leamington Spa, with expert Mark Frank on hand to advise.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: The high-end clients and luxury items continue to roll in, including a celebrity hat designer looking to sell her spectacular diamond-encrusted ruby necklace to raise funds to open a boutique. Paintings by East End gangsters the Kray twins cause a dilemma for the team, and MD James Constantinou tries out a water jet pack. Plus, fake watches lead to a bust-up among staff amid preparations for the grand opening of the flagship store.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A puppy that was attacked with a machete is rescued, prompting members of the team to investigate who was responsible for the crime.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A cat's injury shocks the staff, and when members of the team investigate further they find more abused animals.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Poisons can be deadly and are often almost impossible to detect. Forensic experts show how they can solve these mysterious deaths.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into the vital role of DNA analysis in solving crimes, and how the discovery of a single hair or drop of blood can help to put a criminal behind bars.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Bobby and Sherilyn Jamison, who vanished along with their six-year-old daughter Madison in Oklahoma in October 2009. Detectives eventually uncovered a series of disconnected leads pointing to drugs, family dysfunction, and even supernatural beliefs.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Liz and John Calvert, who vanished in March 2008 from Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, where they ran a boating resort business. Shortly before they went missing some financial discrepancies were found in their bank accounts, and suspicion fell on their accountant Dennis Gerwing - who committed suicide a day after being named a person of interest in relation to their disappearance.

programme.title: True Crime with Aphrodite Jones
programme.desc: The story of a rookie police officer passed a cold case to investigate. David Jackson had been missing since 1988, but in analysing matters 15 years later, Donna Velazquez not only managed to solve the case, but also unveil a sinister murder plot.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The red carpet is rolled out in this edition of the show, and with a celebrity in the salon, there is no shortage of attitude.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole shops with the help of her psychic aunt, Desiree consults her 90-year-old grandmother and Allyson tries to match a century-old veil with a modern dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Randi is having a carnival wedding and wants a polka-dot gown, while opera singer Mary seeks a dress to match her personality.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole leaves her young quadruplets at home as she shops, while cancer patient Margo wants a dress that will give her a boost.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Heather looks for a dramatic gown that complements her hips, while body-conscious Kristyn finally drops by, having avoided wedding dress shopping for a year.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Shari looks for a vow renewal dress with her fussy husband, Alex must find a gown in 24 hours and Ebony feels nervous about her fitting.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: A woman who met a wall of silence in the search for her birth mother, who she thinks once visited her. Plus, a family's tragedy that turned to healing during a reunion.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Unable to care for herself, Katrina's weight has placed a burden on her parents. It is feared she has left it too late to repair the damage to her body.

programme.title: My 3000lb Family
programme.desc: Casey is angered when his parent's blame his obesity on video games, and Amanda suffers from post-surgery pains so bad that she has to go into hospital.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: A man seeks surgery to remove his excess skin and hernia in the hope it will improve his self-confidence and allow him to start dating again.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: A woman with excessive hair growth is desperate to move forward with her life and seeks a diagnosis for the condition.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: FBI agents track down bank robbers and a desperate fugitive who plundered thousands of dollars and started a crime wave.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The use of forensic technology in the search for some of America's 1.8 million missing persons, from runaways who find their way home to those who vanish for ever without trace.
